headline: Sausage Stuffed Jalapeños
description: Stuffed jalapeños with a cheesy sausage filling are baked until golden and bubbly on top. Serve with ranch dressing for a delicious spicy treat!

video.description: Your go-to cheesy, spicy, zesty appetizer for Game Night, potluck or party time!
video.name: Sausage Stuffed Jalapenos

name: Sausage Stuffed Jalapeños
recipeIngredient: 1 pound large fresh jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Place sausage in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir until evenly brown; drain.
Mix sausage, cream cheese, and Parmesan cheese together in a large bowl.
Spoon about 1 tablespoon of sausage mixture into each jalapeño half; arrange stuffed halves in baking dishes.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Serve with ranch dressing.

review.reviewBody: I’ve made these several times - most recently tonight for the Super Bowl. They are always a hit and I don’t change a thing! I buy 20 jalapeños and cut in half and have the perfect amount of filling. I choose the medium sized peppers if I can - too big is just too much pepper. These are easy to make but cutting and deseeding the pepper can be a bit labor intensive. I wear disposable gloves and a mask (Covid has made this easier). You’ll burn your hands if not protected. The mask helps a lot. The fumes from the pepper can be intense. I cut off the stems, slice in half and use a spoon to scoop out the seeds and then rinse the pepper half. If you prepare the jalapeño halves and brown the sausage the night before, prep can be super easy. I use Jimmy Dean breakfast sausage in the tube wrap. Make sure you put your cream cheese out to soften, mix it to loosen it up and add the browned sausage and and Parmesan cheese. I fill the peppers, put on a tray and cover until I’m ready to cook. Great dish to prepare ahead of time and pop in the oven when you’re ready. I don’t serve with ranch - it’s so good without. These are actually even good when they’re cooled off after an hour or two. There will be none left!
Sooooo good and yummy. I put smoked provolone cheese on before putting them in the oven. Delicious 😋

I made this dish for my poker group today. Everyone loved them; I prepared 28 halves and came home with zero. I added about 1 tbsp of minced garlic and topped with freshly-fried, chopped bacon and sliced scallions. I will make these again!
Was awesome loved it..... But was not too crazy about having ranch with it. I really believe that it's great just the way it is.. Thanks again
I have made these several times now and absolutely love them.
These poppers are 10/10! Everyone loves them!
Used the Hot flavored sausage. Only change I made. Very good!

Added crushed red peppers to the sausage when cooking it. A thick slice of butter was added to the filling. I also softened the filling in the microwave for 40sec. Added chives on top of the cheese! Amazing recipe

We have been baking, frying, and grilling versions of this recipe for years. Always a hit. Never leftovers no matter how many we bake or fry or grill. The trick is to keep them in a warming container so they do not get cold. But they get eaten so quickly that rarely has it been a need. Have seen prize winning casseroles languish as these are more preferred. We have also used hatch and poblano chilies as well. mix and match. We have mixed in habanero chilies with the cream cheese for those who like to suffer when they eat. We have varied the meats/sausages as well. lamb, duck, venison, chicken, bison, beef, pork, and even salmon, crab, and shrimp. Various cheeses and cheese blends have also been used. One is only limited by one's imagination.

Lacked a bit in flavor. Add 1/2 tsp garlic powder and thinly sliced scallions, green tops included. I use shredded cheddar & shredded parmesan. Panko crumbs and a bit of olive oil to moisten & dried parsley for the topping adds a nice little crunch.
Have been making these for a couple of years, excellent "football Food"
Love these! The only thing I change is to add cumin to the sausage while cooking for some added flavor. If you like cumin - game changer😉
Always a hit at pot lucks
very good but placed a strip of bacon on top and baked in oven
These were great with a bit of cajun seasoning sprinkled on top as well.
Love these so easy! I also made them using the small sweet peppers.
This is a really good recipe just as it is! Both sides of our families love these!! There is definitely no leftovers lol!!
We make this all the time. It's easy and yummy. Have to be careful, sometimes the jalapenos can be really hot.

I have made these several times and they are always a hit. I never use the optional Ranch dressing. Be sure to drain the browned sausage well on paper towels. And be sure to wear latex gloves when slicing and seeding the peppers! I have pre-baked the emply peppers for 8 minutes or so, and also not pre-baked. I find I like the firmer texture of the pepper better by NOT pre-baking. The filling makes enough for 20 peppers, 1 Tbsp each (40 halves).
I have to make these every time there is a get-together. We love them! I sprinkle some parmesan cheese on the tops.
Great... if you tweak it! Add sautéed onions and garlic. Add crumbled cooked bacon to the mix. I get this dish requested when we socialize.
Excellent. Big hit
good recipe. good for low carb eating. my batch actually allowed me to use 16 peppers.
Brought these to our neighborhood super bowl party a few years ago and now i am required by the hosts to bring it every year! Nuff said.
Super EASY and delicious!! My boyfriend LOVES this recipe!!
Delicious

If you think you love this recipe how it is or if it just wasn't cutting it for you, you MUST TRY this recipe with MAPLE sausage. It sounds weird but people that dont even like maple sausage will eat these up when I make them. Again, maple sausage is a must.

These were so good! I made them for my family - who really liked them, but would definitely bring them to an event. I was a little worried, but the jalapeños weren't too spicy after being cooked. I used a small pampered chef scoop (any will do) and then rolled/squished the filling into the shape (cigar) of the jalapeños. I didn't buy the suggested amount of jalapeños (didn't want that many) and had leftover filling, which I baked in the shape of the scoop, along side the others. We ate those too. I'd buy more jalapeños next time knowing now that we all loved them. Just finished off the leftovers and just as good the 2nd time around.

This tastes great just the way it is written and is easy to make. I put the bacon in the microwave for 2 minutes before wrapping the 1/2 peppers to have the bacon a bit more cooked (though it is still not crisp) after baking. My family eats them without any ranch dressing.
Skip the parm add sharp cheddar and franks hot sauce
They were AMAZING!! Definitely making again!!
I had frsh poblano peppers on hand so I used them. A milder pepper but larger. They turned out so good and were so easy. In the mixture I added a diced tomato and leftover corn. It turned out great
I followed the recipe directions. I wouldn't change anything. The combination of the flavors are fantastic!

I love this recipe!
I did change a few things after trying it several times.
I sprinkled a little sugar in each jalapeno before stuffing it, I increased the proportion of cream cheese a little, and added about a 1/4 cup of sour cream.
Awesome!
Soooooooooo good!!!! I think the portions will make about 2 pounds if jalapeño though. Had a lot left over with just 1lb

I used bratwurst for the sausage since I didn't have the other. Removed the casing and added diced onions. Wrapped in bacon and OMG!!! 
These are perfect for making ahead and freeze very well! I froze almost 2 dozen before they were cooked. Always came out like just made!
These are so easy and delicious..I do add some of the seeds otherwise there isn’t much heat...I’ve made them multiple times and always a hit...

I've made this recipe many, many times and all the guys love it! In fact, I'm making it right now. It took me a long time to figure out the easiest way for me to handle the sausage. It is always hard to get that sausage to behave in the fry pan. There is something stringy about it that always made it hard to break up into the small pieces that you need for yummy poppers. What I settled on was to buy the premade (hot) Italian sausage patties - four to the pound. I fry it up in its own grease and then here's my secret. I use kitchen scissors and cut the cooked patties into small pieces maybe the size of a quarter. Then I throw these pieces into a Vitamix (although I bet most blenders would work fine) and zoom them for a few seconds on a low speed and "viola" -perfect popper sausage every time. You're welcome.

I love these! I don't usually use parmesan, I use whatever cheese I have, and I usually wrap them in bacon. I put them on a rack on a cookie sheet wrapped in aluminum foil for quick cleanup, or put them on the grill. THE BEST!!
Delicious we love this recipe, thanks for sharing.

I made it just like the directions said... baked 20 minutes and they were delicious. I used some smaller and larger jalapenos. I loaded them up and thought they would melt and run out but the cheese mixture stayed in tack and browned perfectly. I only made half a the recipe but splitting the ingredients down the middle worked perfect.
This came out so amazing. We made this 2 days in a row.

Very good recipe! Just like my grandma's. I used homegrown jalepeños for mine. Some had more heat than others. Took these to my in-laws for dinner and they are not the spicy food type of people but they loved them!
Very good. Added bacon bits on top but other then that, no changes
I've tried several different stuffed jalapeno recipes and this one is by far has the best flavor..
So good! Keto friendly! Took them to a Super Bowl party and everyone loved them. I used grated cheddar instead of Parmesan.
KETO Friendly!! My go-to recipe for the past 5 yrs. We love this recipe. I like to sprinkle more parmesan on top of the peppers before baking them.

I have made these peppers many times and they are ALWAYS gone at parties, even when I’ve made more than the basic recipe. If they’re still on the platter people keep eating them. Gave it 5 stars because the basic recipe is so good but I have changed it up from time to time. I always use HOT pork sausage (remember, the peppers themselves aren’t hot if you remove all the seeds and white membranes), and sometimes I mix in a little shredded cheddar blend or some pecorino Romano, just depends on what’s in the fridge. Even people who say they “don’t like hot stuff” that try them always love them, it’s the perfect blend of soft baked peppers, sausage and CHEESE!
I used asagio and parmesan cheese. I'd use a little less cream cheese as well next time. Overall they were good.
Every one loved it
My family loved these!!! So yummy!!!
Delicious, great party snack
I brought it to a. Christmas party and it was a hit. It was so easy to make also. The filling makes enough for more than 1 pound of peppers. It’s more like 1 1/3 pounds.
I used Jimmy Dean HOT sausage

Wonderfully simple and delightful recipe! Made it for thanksgiving dinner, for a slightly different change on tradition. Started with two dozen peppers, thought I was over doing it. Had zero left overs, everyone loves them!
YUM! Everytime I make these they are gone fast!
Great recipe. Everyone loved them. I will add some of the seeds into the mixture next time to add some heat. Not hot at all without.

I tried this recipe with a mix of jalapeño and sweet peppers since I was not certain how spicy the recipe was. I used store bought peppers. I was able to use one recipe for 22 peppers. The jalapeños were not too spicy. Next time I’ll use them exclusively. We did not need the salad dressing. I had ranch dip and onion dip available for dipping but the peppers were so yummy and cheesy they were not needed. One family member who likes spicy, has made jalapeño poppers himself said these were really good. He typically wraps his in bacon and cooks them in the smoker. I think he was surprised at how good these were and soooo easy to make.
Omg yum!! Put then on paper towels immediately after cooking and before serving to absorb the grease. Followed the recipe exactly. Boyfriend asked me make these for his co-workers
best ever! whole batch gone in 5 minutes and people wanted more! have shared recipe with so many.

Delicious! A bit time-consuming, but relatively easy. I didn't have parmesan, so I used mozarella, which worked out great. I made too many for my small group. I'm going to see how well they freeze, either already cooked or uncooked. I hope to get back to this to reply. :P
Added bacon to the mixture
These are very good. I had to make my own breakfast sausage so I think it affected the flavor. I think they would be very good without the meat or with Chorizo sausages. I would make these again.
I love these. I make the filling, stuff the jalapeño and freeze on a plate then bag them up. AWESOME from freezer to an air fryer :)
Made with yellow banana peppers, otherwise followed recipe - used mild sausage. Whole pan was gone at our wine club!

This was awesome. I think it will be my go to app. Seems like you could do everything in the AM and then refrigerate until yo're ready to put them in the oven. They browned so nicely and the peppers were so sweet.

I made a vegetarian option of these with gardein beetles ground (frozen isle at Giant) and added a shallot finely chopped. Same amount of cream cheese and parmesan. You need to heat the ground slowly and add the cheese to it warm because it's premade. Delicious! I will make the sausage for my carnivorous friends. Thanks for sharing this.

The best finger food ever! Now every event I attend they ask me the bring the stuffed peppers. I don’t change a thing in the recipe. I do use hot jimmy dean sausage to give it a little more heat. AWESOME RECIPE!
Made as directed, but baked for 30 minutes to brown tops. Will use parchment paper next time. I may try with some pepper jack cheese instead of Parmesan next time. Will make again
I added a shredded 4 cheese blend and a dash of garlic powder to my dish.
Very delicious!

These are amazing ! I made them last night and even though some of our friends do not care for spicy/hot foods they actually tried these and were quite impressed. This appetizer will now be on 'go to list' in the future !

I have made these before and they are very good. I add some fresh garlic to the sausage when cooking. Always drain the grease from sausage with paper towel! I used Parmesan and shredded mozzarella cheeses. I just mix all ingredients together in the rinsed pan after cooking the sausage. It mixes easily that way. Be sure to cook the cleaned/halved jalapeños in the oven on 350 degrees for about 12 minutes before stuffing so they will be softer. Wear gloves when cleaning the peppers! U can make the day before and just bake the next day if you store in air tight container in fridge.
Have made several times. Everyone raves!!

I made these for my wife and I, went by the recipe and made about 24 med sized peppers and still had about half the mixture left.... so, I had some small sweet peppers in the fridge and stuffed them too...try it..! They were better than the jalapeño poppers were, which were out of this world good...!

These have been a family favorite for years, they all insist we bring them to every family function. We make ours slightly differently but they taste almost the same, if not... a little better. We use 1 pckg of bulk sausage, 1 8oz pckg cream cheese, & Old Bay seasoning (to taste, u have to keep adding until u get to desired saltiness & flavor.) I usually cook the filling a day ahead of time bc it’s easier to handle & stuff the peppers when it’s chilled. I bake them at 375 for about 30-35 mins. I fill the baking sheet w/ as many peppers as I can, that’s why I bake that long. If I’m only making a handful then I bake for about 20 mins. This also depends on size of peppers. I look for the really big ones because stuffing peppers is fairly tedious. Make sure u use gloves when working w/ peppers, I’ve gotten some bad burns from them!!! Once you try these, you will be addicted!
Holy cow these are so delicious. We made them twice. So easy, too. I can't give high enough praise.
One of my favorite appetizer recipe's. I spice it up a little with red pepper flakes and chipotle seasoning. Yum!
One of my favorite appetizer recipe's. I spice it up a little with red pepper flakes and chipotle seasoning. Yum!
These were grrrreat! I made these exactly as the recipe called for. These make for a great app when company is over!!

These are addictive and SO delicious. I didn't have parmesan cheese so I used cheddar cheese and they tasted great. I scooped out all the seeds and they were just the right about of heat. Real heat lovers could probably leave some of the seeds.
Had 2 left over so I wrapped them in plastic wrap and froze them. Later, took them out, put them in the microwave and they were ready to go. Nice to make some ahead and have a few whenever you want without all the mess to make them 
from scratch. Thanks for sharing this recipe.

Super easy to do. If you cant do this, stay out of the kitchen. When mixing sausage and cheese mixture, do it by hand. Dont crumble your sausage up too small. People tend to like the texture of knowing there is meat in there. 
 You could substitute cheddar or other cheeses. I used spicy sausage that really wasnt that spicy. so i add some crushed red pepper flakes and diced onions when i was cooking sausage. 
 It turned out excellent. Thank you.

These are AMAZING! Even my 9 year old son loved these, he ate 5 with dinner! Only thing I would change, is to add a little more cream cheese-my package of sausage was a little over a pound. Will make these again!
PERFECT :just follow the recipe, as is.
Quick and easy to make, not very hot so my wife Loved them, they will definitely be in my appetizer book.
Delicious! Used Jimmy Dean sausage and drained well. Threw a little mozzarella on top last 5 minutes.
Made them for the Super Bowl. They were a hit!

I just made it for Super Bowl party. It sounded too easy so i made some alterations just for fun, like some reviews suggested. I used 11 large jalapeño peppers, cut in halves and gutted with tiny measuring spoon, kept tails on; i used hot Italian sausage, although it turned out too mild anyway, next time i will add red hot flakes, or cayenne. I used only half of Philadelphia amount; I used Parmesan half in half with mixed shredded cheeses we had at home, total amount as in original recipe. I fried and drained sausage, and at the same pan caramelized two table spoon of chopped sweet onion and two little cloves of garlic, chopped, and aged to the meat. I shaped by hand little “sausages” from staffing and inserted into the peppers halves, easy and quick. I used baking as one review suggested 350 F for about 30 min. All proportions were ideal, all peppers were stuffed and no leftover stuffing. Everybody liked it.
Always a huge hit at a party!
Awesome fresh "poppers"...you'll never buy frozen again! Incredibly easy to make, and certain to be a hit at EVERY function you attend!
Super easy.. the mix keeps the heat at a great temperature for all tastes
These were delicious. I had plenty of filling left - could have filled 3 or 4 more peppers.
Never have even one of these left. So good!
I've made these three times. 20 each time. All devoured. Everyone loved them.
I have made this recipe numerous times. They are loved and gone in 20 minutes. I am always asked to make them.
A big hit with everyone. You can also use poblanos if you want less heat.
My family LOVES these and request often!! Usually just sprinkle a little more parm on top.
we have made it many times and love it.
we have made it many times and love it.
